Perfect Stride is a game with many levels of strategy with just the right amount of luck blended in.  How fast should I ride?  Who is in the lead?  Should I sacrifice my draw to get ahead of other Riders?  Should I save specific Skill cards to use later on?  When should I take the lead from another rider?  Perfect Stride is a game you will want to play again and again.

Included in the game is a beautifully illustrated 95-card deck, 54 Ribbon Point Cards, 16 Pace Cards, a Lead Rider token and Rulebook.

Name: MISSION: I.S.S.
Description:
MISSION:I.S.S.  pits player against each other in an effort to win the space race of the 21st century. Acting as the USA, Russia, ESA, or NASDA (Japanese space agency) each player must fund and launch 5 modules to connect to the International Space Station. This is not so easy when you realize that other players can exert political influence requiring you to launch modules for them, and can even be involved in delaying or destroying missions as they happen.

Featuring 3d modeled graphics, and easy to learn rules, MISSION:I.S.S. raises awareness of the space program and some of the real (and not so real) difficulties faced in space exploration and funding.

Name: Social Security Special
Description: Social Security Special is similar to Aggravation, in that players must navigate their pawns around a uni-directional track while avoiding their opponent's pieces, to become the first to bring all their pawns safely "home",  This game, however, differs in that it is played in teams and that movement is determined by card playing, not dice rolls.  Players begin with 5 regular playing cards in their hand, drawing one card and playing one card of their choice per turn.  Each card allows specific movement on the board.  Landing on an opponent's piece will return it to their "start" space.  First team to reach home with all their pawns wins.

Name: Aladdin: The Series
Description: A simple spin and move game, moving between the treasure locations to reveal and collect treasure tokens. If a revealed token is a thief instead, start your next turn from the thieve's hideout. Some movement spaces may force you to lose a treasure to Iago's hiding place, but you may also land on a magic carpet which allows you to go anywhere on the board, including Iago's hiding place where you can take all that stolen treasure. When all the treasure tokens are claimed, the player with the most wins.

Name: Global Resolution
Description:
Gobal Simulation circa 1990-2010. Each player takes the role of 1 Nation: USA, Russia, EU, China, Japan, or India. Each 
Nation has 4 Traits: Economy, Military, Social, and Environmental. Players play Development Cards to improve their traits. Each player draws 1 card from the Crisis deck each turn. There are 10+ types of Crises, most requiring a decision on the part of the player on how to resolve them. Some decisions are riskier than others. Through resolution of Crises, players earn Prestige Points which will ultimately determine the winner.

Name: Bedmas
Description:
Everyone gets the same set of mathematical operators (+,-,=, etc.) to use for the entire game. Each round, a set of numbers is drawn. Each player must form an equation using at least one of the operators and as many of the digits as he or she likes. The equation with the highest value wins the round.
(user summary)

Name: Tanks in the Middle East 1917
Description:
During the summer of 1917, the Turks were blocking the road to Palestine. They had been retreating until reaching the Gaza, where there reinforced and built extensive trench defenses. The Turks were always tough and after the 1st Battle of Gaza slipped through the British hands, the British also re-equipped- with tanks! It was hoped that these monsters would wreck the Turk defenses and cause them to flee opening up Palestine to the British. Naval monitors would bombard Gaza from the sea. The Turks were not easy prey especially in prepared defenses and with the help of German aircraft above. Once again both prepared for yet another showdown.

The game comes with a 11x17" map, 280 counters, rules. The map scale is about 800 yards per hex. Each combat unit is one platoon to company .

Name: Second World War at Sea: Combined Fleet
Description:
(from the APL website :)

During the late spring and early summer of 1942, the Imperial Japanese Navy launched a series of aggressive operations. Barely taking time to refuel, Japanese carriers and cruisers struck the Dutch East Indies and Ceylon. Committing a basic error of dividing their forces, the Japanese then split their fleet carriers into two groups for Operations MO and MI, which resulted in the Battles of Midway and the Coral Sea.

Combined Fleet is a 64-page book supplement to the Second World War at Sea series, focusing on Japanese and American plans and options for these two climactic battles. There are 20 scenarios, or separate game situations, based on both actual actions and potential battles that could have taken place with the forces that both sides either could have committed or discussed sending to the battle zone.

This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Coral Sea and Midway to enjoy most of he scenarios, with some pieces also drawn from Bismarck, Bomb Alley, Strike South and Eastern Fleet.


http://www.avalanchepress.com/gameCombinedFleet.php

System Description at http://www.avalanchepress.com/line_WWIISea.php
Families: Series: Second World War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: Tischfußball
Description:
A football-Simulation that the author used for his own leage. It is a rather complex simulation with a lot of dice-rolling and many rules, really designed to simulate a (European) football game.
The dice decide over angle height and speed of the ball, but can be influenced by the players. Since its a complex simulation and would take quite some time, the game is played over a fixed time.

Name: Munchkin Santa's Revenge
Description:
Publisher's Description (from website)The Munchkin was sleeping all snug in his bed, when Santa came back with a BOOT TO THE HEAD!

Santa's Revenge is a holiday-themed supplement for any Munchkin game. It goes especially well with Waiting for Santa, but you don't need WFS to enjoy Santa's Revenge. It adds Santa monsters like Harold Angel (as in, HARK!) and the Anti-Clause. And it gives you new things to hit those monsters with, from Snowballs to the North Pole. And the new Armor is Christmas Wrapping. John Kovalic had fun drawing this one. (Actually, he had fun with them all. You can tell by looking. You'll have fun too.)

This is an expansion for Munchkin, not a stand-alone set. Santa's Revenge is not collectible or randomized; every pack is the same as every other.

				
				
					OtherPart of the Munchkin series.

Name: Trafalgore
Description:
Trafalgore (Fyre As She Bares) is a free supplement for the Slaughterloo and Flintloque games.

It has a story about a navel engagment between the Orcs and the Elves, and the rules for the Orcs sailors and Marines.

It was first published in a Alternative Armies news letter, but has also been relesed as a free PDF.

Name: Au tableau
Description:
Each player is in a classroom with 5 (short games) or 10 (long games) schoolchild. One of them is in front of the blackboard.

Each player can play on his turn can draw a card and play one card for chalenge one opponent or all other players with little schoolyard games :

"Ni oui ni non"
"Jeu de la barbichette"
"Chi Fou Mi"
Counting
"Jeu du béret"
"Mains Chaudes"
etc...

The schoolchild of the winning player move to the next grade and leave the game.

The first player with no schoolchild win the game.
